definition: to slip out of sth/to hide sth in one's sleeve
to take off (clothes)/to shed feathers/(of color) to fade/to discolor

sentences.english: The colors arent fast, so be careful when you wash this shirt.
sentences.chinese: 這些顏色易褪色，所以洗襯衫時要小心。
您的衣服是不褪色的嗎？

sentences.english: The disease gets its name from streaks of yellow and white that discolor the leaves.
sentences.chinese: 這個病疫得名於它會使玉米的葉子褪色，變成黃白色。

sentences.english: He had removed his shoes and donned a pair of blue, faded carpet-slippers.
sentences.chinese: 沒有穿鞋，腳上蹬着一雙褪色的蘭色地毯拖。

sentences.english: North flocks old tenants left Beijing property market why splendor faded?
sentences.chinese: 成羣老住戶的離開京北樓市爲何光彩褪色？

sentences.english: Surprisingly, its co-lors had still not turned yellowish pale.
sentences.chinese: 令人驚訝的是，照片還沒有泛黃褪色。

sentences.english: F-0804 For assessing specimen's change in color after color fastness test.
sentences.chinese: 用以對照判定染色堅牢度試驗後，試片變褪色之等級。

sentences.english: As ladybugs age, the color of their spots fades.
sentences.chinese: 隨着瓢蟲年齡的增長他們身上的色彩和圖案逐漸褪色。

sentences.english: Sapphire and faded jeans, I hope you get your dreams.
sentences.chinese: 穿上已褪色的藍寶石色的牛仔褲，我希望你做追夢人。

sentences.english: The Propper Tactical Trouser will not fade, wrinkle or shrink.
sentences.chinese: PROPPER戰術多袋長褲不會褪色，起皺或收縮。

sentences.english: This advanced dyeing technology can make the products unfading.
sentences.chinese: 這種先進的印染技術，使產品永不褪色。

sentences.english: The sunshine would discolour the paint.
Even the gold will be tanished.
The colour of the red flag has been dulled by age.
sentences.chinese: 那面紅旗因年深日久而褪色了。

definition: variant of 褪色[tui4 se4]/also pr. [tui4 shai3]
to lose color/to fade/also pr. [diao4 shai3]
to lose color/to turn pale/to bleach/to fade
to drop off/to come off/to lose (hair etc)/to omit (a character when writing)
to peel off (paint)/(fig.) to be exposed/to lose face (Tw)
